\documentclass{article}
\usepackage{amsmath}
\setlength\parskip{\medskipamount}
\setlength\parindent{0pt}

%__________________________________.........................................
%  Define some latex commands to reduce the length of the equations
%__________________________________........................................
\newcommand{\pd}[2]{\ensuremath{\frac{\partial#1}{\partial#2}}  }
\newcommand{\pbox}[1]{\ensuremath{\parbox[c]{.27\linewidth}{\scriptsize{#1}}}  }
\newcommand{\pboxsmall}[1]{\ensuremath{\parbox[c]{.2\linewidth}{\scriptsize{#1}}}  }
\newcommand{\graybox}[1]{\psboxit{box .7 setgray fill}{\textbf{#1}} }
%__________________________________
%  no time superscript
%__________________________________                
\newcommand{\um}{\ensuremath{\vec{U}_{m}}}                     % Vel.mat. m
\newcommand{\uo}{\ensuremath{\vec{U}_o}}                       % density
\newcommand{\delt}{\ensuremath{\Delta{t}} }                    % Delta t
\newcommand{\delx}{\ensuremath{\Delta{x}} }                    % Delta x
\newcommand{\dely}{\ensuremath{\Delta{y}} }                    % Delta y
\newcommand{\delz}{\ensuremath{\Delta{z}} }                    % Delta z
\newcommand{\rhom}{\ensuremath{\rho_m}}                        % density mat m
\newcommand{\rhoo}{\ensuremath{\rho_o}}                        % density 
\newcommand{\alpham}{\ensuremath{\alpha_m}}                    % alpha mat m
\newcommand{\sumarea}{\ensuremath{\sum_{i=1}^{n}}}                   
%__________________________________
%  time n quantities
%__________________________________

\newcommand{\Vn}{\ensuremath{V^{n}_{m}}}                       % volume @ n for mat. k
\newcommand{\mn}{\ensuremath{m^{n}_{m}}}                       % mass @ n for mat. k
\newcommand{\un}{\ensuremath{\vec{U}^{n}_{m}}}                 % Vel. @ n for mat. k
\newcommand{\Tn}{\ensuremath{T^{n}_{m}}}                       % Temp. @ n for mat. k
\newcommand{\pnc}{\ensuremath{p^{n^c}} }                       % cell centered time n pressure
\newcommand{\en}{\ensuremath{e^{n}_{m}}}                       % internal energy @ n for mat. k
\newcommand{\Vnf}{\ensuremath{V^{n^{f}}}}                      % volume @ n face value
\newcommand{\mnf}{\ensuremath{m^{n^{f}}}}                      % mass @ n  face value
\newcommand{\unf}{\ensuremath{\vec{U}^{n^{f}}}}                % Vel. @ n face value
\newcommand{\rhonf}{\ensuremath{\rho^{n^{f}}}}                 % Face centered density
\newcommand{\rhonc}{\ensuremath{\rho^{n^{c}}}}                 % cell centered density 
\newcommand{\rhoncl}{\ensuremath{\rho^{n^{c}}_r}}              % cell centered density (right)
\newcommand{\unc}{\ensuremath{\vec{U}^{n^{c}}}}                % Vel. @ n, cell centered 
\newcommand{\spvol}{\ensuremath{ \upsilon^{n^{c}} } }
\newcommand{\uvelnc}{\ensuremath{ u^{n^{c}} } }
\newcommand{\vvelnc}{\ensuremath{ v^{n^{c}} } }
\newcommand{\wvelnc}{\ensuremath{ w^{n^{c}} } }
%__________________________________
%  n quantities I,J,K
%__________________________________
\newcommand{\unIJK}{\ensuremath{u^{n}_{I,J,K}}}
\newcommand{\vnIJK}{\ensuremath{v^{n}_{I,J,K}}}
\newcommand{\wnIJK}{\ensuremath{w^{n}_{I,J,K}}}
%__________________________________
%  n + 1/2 quantities
%__________________________________
\newcommand{\nadv}{\text{\tiny{n+1}}}                              % ntilde
\newcommand{\VL}{\ensuremath{V^{\nadv^{L}}_{m}}}              % Lagran. Volume @n for mat. k
\newcommand{\mL}{\ensuremath{m^{\nadv^{L}}_{m}}}              % Lagran. mass @ n form mat. k
\newcommand{\uL}{\ensuremath{ \vec{U}^{\nadv^{L}}_{m}}  }     % Lagran. Vel @ n for mat. k 
\newcommand{\unLf}{\ensuremath{\vec{U}^{\nadv^{L^{f}}}}}      % Vel. @ n face value
\newcommand{\uvelstar}{\ensuremath{ u^{\nadv^{*^{f}}}}  }     % face u Vel @ n + 1/2 
\newcommand{\vvelstar}{\ensuremath{ v^{\nadv^{*^{f}}}}  }     % face v Vel @ n + 1/2
\newcommand{\wvelstar}{\ensuremath{ w^{\nadv^{*^{f}}}}  }     % face w Vel @ n + 1/2
\newcommand{\TL}{\ensuremath{ T^{\nadv^{L}}_{m}}  }
\newcommand{\ustar}{\ensuremath{\vec{U}^{\nadv^{*^{f}}}}}     % Vel. @ n face value
\newcommand{\udummy}{\ensuremath{\hat{ \vec{U} }^{\nadv^{f}}  } }    % u tilde, face
\newcommand{\pstar}{\ensuremath{p^{\nadv^{*^{f}}}}}           % Vel. @ n face value
\newcommand{\pLc}{\ensuremath{p^{\nadv^{L^c}}} }              % Lagran. cell centered time n pressure
\newcommand{\delpc}{\ensuremath{ \Delta p^{\nadv^{c}}  } }    % delta cell centered time n pressure
\newcommand{\rhonnf}{\ensuremath{\rho^{n^{f}}}}             % Face centered density

\makeatother

\begin{document}
\Large
\sffamily
\underline{\textbf{Uintah:ICE Multi-material code} }
%__________________________________
% Algorithm
%__________________________________
\begin{itemize}
%
\item \textbf{Equation of state,$p^{n+1}, \theta^{n+1}$}\\
\\
\item \textbf{Calculate the chemistry effects, phase change and energy release,} (explicit)\\
\\
\item \textbf{Solve the ``pressure equations" for $\ustar,\delpc, \pstar$}
(implicit, approximate  projection method)\\
\\
%
\item \textbf{Evaluate the pressure acceleration, body forces and stresses,}
(explicit).  \textbf{For multiple materials, calculate the momentum and
energy exchange,} (implicit).  \textbf{Add the Lagrangian effects into
$\vec{U}^{{n+1}^{L}}_m, T^{{n+1}^{L}}_m, \rho^{{n+1}^{L}}_m$}\\
\\
%
\item \textbf{Advect $\un,~\Tn,~\rho^{n}_m$}\\
\\
\item \textbf{Advance in time $\rho^{{n+1}^{C}}_m,~\vec{U}^{{n+1}^{C}}_m, T^{{n+1}^{C}}_m$}\\
\\
\end{itemize}
\newpage
%
The steps for a single time step are: 
%
\begin{enumerate}
\item \textbf{Calculate the cell-centered pressure using the equation of state}$,~p^{n+1}, \theta^{n+1}_m$\\
\\
\item \textbf{Calculate effects of a chemical reaction, phase change and energy release}, 
$\langle \mn \dot{\alpham} \rangle, \langle m^{n}_{m} \un \dot{\alpha_{m}} \rangle, \langle \mn \en \dot{\alpha_{m}} \rangle$\\
%
%
%
%__________________________________
% "pressure equations"
%__________________________________
\item \textbf{ Solve the ``pressure equations" for \delpc.  Using \delpc
calculate the cell-centered velocity of material $m$, \( U_{m}^{n^{c}} \)
to the face-center \( U_{m}^{*^{f}} \)}\\
%
%
\begin{equation*}
\ustar = 
 \overbrace{ \frac{ (\rho\vec{U})^{n^{f}} }{ \rhonnf} }^{  
\text{  \pboxsmall{   (Cell-centered data from adjacent cells interpolated to the face center)}  } }
- \overbrace{ \frac{ \delt }{\rhonnf }\nabla^f(p^{n^{c}} + \delpc)  }^{ \text{  \pboxsmall{   (Linear approximation to the time advance pressure)} } }
+ \overbrace{ \vec{g}  \delt  }^{
\text{  \pboxsmall{   (body force term)}  } }
\end{equation*}
+ Multimaterial coupling term
\\
\\
\item \textbf{Calculate the face-centered pressure \( p^{*^{n^{f}}} \)at each of the faces
with the surrounding cell-centered pressures.}
\\
\begin{equation*}
p^{*^{f}} = \frac{ \frac{p^{c}_{I+1}}{\rho^{c}_{I+1}} + \frac{p^{c}_{I}}{\rho^{c}_{I}} }{
\frac{1}{\rho^{c}_{I}} + \frac{1}{\rho^{c}_{I+1}}} 
\end{equation*}
\\
%
\newpage
%
\item \textbf{With the face-centered~\( U_{m}^{f} \) ,\( p^{n^{*^{f}}} \) calculate the source
terms for the energy and momentum equations.}\\
\\
%__________________________________
% mass source terms
%__________________________________
\underline{Mass source/sink term}
\begin{alignat*}{3}
\Delta{(m_{m})}^{\nadv} =
&\Delta{t}\langle \mn \dot{\alpham} \rangle
&\text{\pbox{(source of mass resulting from phase change)} }
\end{alignat*}
\\
%__________________________________
% Velocity source terms
%__________________________________
\underline{Velocity source/sink terms}
\begin{alignat*}{3}
\frac{  \Delta{(m_{m}\um)}^{\nadv}  }{  \mL  } = 
&\frac{  \Delta{t}\langle m^{n}_{m} \un \dot{\alpha_{m}} \rangle  }{ \mL  } 
&\text{  \pbox{   (net source of $m$ momentum due to m mass conversion)}  }\\ 
&+ \frac{ V^n\vec{g}\Delta{t} }{\VL}
&\text{ \pbox{(acceleration due to gravity)} } \\
& - \frac{  \upsilon_{m}\Delta{t} \int_{A} \pstar d\vec{S}  }{  \VL  } 
&\text{ \pbox{(acceleration due to the equilibration pressure) }} \\
& + \frac{  \upsilon_{m}\theta_{l}\Delta{t}V^{n}K({\vec{U}}^{n^{L}}_{l} - \vec{U}^{n^{L}}_{m} )  }{  \VL } 
&\text{\pbox{  (interactions between materials $m$ and $l$.  For a single fluid this term =0)}} \\
& + \frac{ \Delta{t} \int_{A} \tau^{f}_{m} \cdot d\vec{S} }{ \mL }  
&\text{\pbox{  (acceleration due to material stresses)}} \\
&\text{  + other terms} \notag
\end{alignat*}
%__________________________________
% Energy source terms!
%__________________________________
\underline{{Energy Source Terms}}
\begin{alignat*}{3}
\frac{  \Delta({m_{m}}e_{m})^{\nadv}  }{ \mL  } = 
&\frac{ \Delta{t} \langle \mn \en \dot{\alpha_{m}} \rangle }{  \mL  } 
&\text{\pbox{  (source/sink of $k$ internal energy due to mass conversion )}} \\
&+ \frac{ (\frac{ \upsilon_{m} }{ c_{m} })^2(p^{o}_m\delpc)  }{ \VL}\\
&+ \frac{  \upsilon_k \theta_l \Delta{t} \Vn R(T^{n^{L}}_l - T^{n^L}_{m} )  }{\VL}
&\text{\pbox{  (Energy exchange between materials.  For a single material this = 0)}}\\
&\text{+  other terms}
\end{alignat*}
\\
%
%
\item \textbf{Calculate the Lagrangian values }\\

%__________________________________V Lagr.
\underline{Lagrangian Volume:}
\begin{equation*}
\label{eq:V^n+1}
\VL = V^{n} + \Delta{t}\sum_{i}^{cell~faces}(\vec{S}\cdot \ustar )_{i}
\end{equation*}
%__________________________________rho Lagr.
\underline{Lagrangian Mass:}
\begin{equation*}
\label{eq:rho_bar}
\rho^{\nadv ^{L}}_{m} = \frac{  \rho^{n}_{m}\Vn + 
\overbrace{  \Delta{(m_{m})}^{\nadv}  }^{\text{\pboxsmall{source/sink due to phase change}}}  }{  \VL  }
\end{equation*}
%
%__________________________________m Lagr
\begin{equation*}
\mL=\rho^{\nadv}_{m}{\VL}
\end{equation*}
%
%__________________________________u Lagr
\underline{ Lagrangian Velocity:}\\
\text{ Note: in the source/sink of this equation there is a exchange term}
\text{ which contains the $\uL$.  This must be solved for implicitly.} 
\begin{equation*}
\label{eq:u_tilde}
\uL = \un[1 -  \overbrace{  \frac{  \Delta{ m_{m} }^{\nadv}  }{  \mL}  }^{  \text{\pboxsmall{source/sink due to phase change}}}] + 
\overbrace{  \frac{  \Delta{ (m_{m} \um) }^{\nadv}  }{  \mL}  }^{  \text{source/sink}  }
\end{equation*} 
%  
%__________________________________T Lagr
\underline{Lagrangian Temperature:}\\
\text{ Note: in the source/sink of this equation there is a exchange term}
\text{which contains the $\TL$.  This must be solved for implicitly.} 
\begin{equation*}
\label{eq:T_tilde}
\TL = \Tn[1 - \overbrace{  \frac{ \Delta{ (m_{m} e_m)^{\nadv }}  }{ c_{v}\mL  }  }^{  \text{\pboxsmall{source/sink due to phase change} }  }] +
\overbrace{  \frac{ \Delta{ (m_{m} e_m)^{\nadv }}  }{ c_{v}\mL  }  }^{  \text{source/sink}  }
\end{equation*}  
%
\newpage
%
\item \textbf{Advection of  $\rho^{n}_{m}$,$\un$, $\Tn$}\\
%
\item \textbf{Finally, calculate the time advanced quanties for mass, velocity, and temperature.}\\
%__________________________________
% time advanced V,rho,u,T
%__________________________________
\begin{align}
%__________________________________rho_n+1
\label{eq:rho^n+1}
       \rho^{n+1}_{m} &= \frac{{\rho^{\nadv^{L}}_{m}\VL -
       \Delta{t}\text{Advection}(\rho^{n}_{m})}}{V} , \\         
%__________________________________U_n+1
\label{eq:u^n+1}
       \vec{U}^{n+1}_{m} &=
       \frac{\uL \VL - \Delta{t}\text{Advection}(\un)}{V} ,\\
%__________________________________T_n+1
\label{eq:T^n+1}
       T^{n+1}_{m} &= \frac{\TL \VL -
       \Delta{t}\text{Advection}(\Tn)}{V}
\end{align}

 \end{enumerate}
 
 
 
\end{document}
